Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; trace of lotus flower in added white outline and added red centre; below, two white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of boar (head and part of comb remaining), to right.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Elaborate Animal Chalices. Chalices that fall into this group are usually large and heavy-walled and are also known as chalice kraters. Chalices in this group display elaborate compositions that include polychromy and delicately painted figures (Lemos 1991, 90-1). This sherd is not particularly thick, more typical of regular chalices.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 21)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 90, p. 254, no. 432, pl. 58)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 70)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0565) (phase 2)
